title: Pacers prosper in 13-wicket day in Centurion
byline: An interesting contest brewed in Centurion as South Africa pushed to confirm their place in next year’s ICC World Test Championship (WTC) Final.

title: President Dissanayake expresses interest in joining BRICS
byline: Sri Lankan President Anura Dissanayake expressed interest in joining BRICS in a letter to Russian President Vladimir Putin, the republic’s ambassador to Moscow Pakir Amza told RIA Novosti.

title: Sri Lanka shaped Blue Sapphire found
byline: A gem merchant in Nivithigala has found a blue sapphire in the shape of Sri Lanka.

title: Man with wooden rod pierced in neck saved
byline: The Vavuniya Hospital performed a life-saving surgery to remove a wooden rod lodged in the neck of a man admitted in critical condition.

title: Russia warns against ’hypotheses’ after Azerbaijan Airlines crash
byline: The Russian government has cautioned against promoting ’’hypotheses’’ about the cause of the crash of a Russia-bound passenger plane that killed 38 people in Kazakhstan on Wednesday.

title: Govt. won’t run Neville Fernando Hospital as traditional facility: Minister
byline: Although Rs. 40 million is spent monthly on salary payments for the Dr. Neville Fernando Teaching Hospital (NFTH), the government does not intend to operate the hospital as a traditional government facility, Health and Mass Media Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Virat Kohli fined for bumping into Sam Konstas
byline: The ICC has reportedly handed out punishment to India batting superstar Virat Kohli for shoulder-bumping Australian debutant Sam Konstas during the first day of the 4th Test that got underway in Melbourne on Thursday.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourist arrivals surpass 2 million in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka has welcomed its 2 millionth tourist who arrived from Bangkok this year, at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), after a five-year gap.

title: Railway Department aims to provide people-friendly services, happiness
byline: While assuming duties as the new General Manager of Sri Lanka Railways (GMR) today, Dhammika Jayasundara said that the Railway Department should transform into an institution that brings happiness to the people and to provide a people-friendly service.

title: Traffic officers to wear luminous gear while stopping vehicles at night
byline: The Acting Inspector General of Police has issued new directives for officers on traffic duty regarding procedures for stopping vehicles at night.

title: Nearly 9,000 drivers face legal action for drunk driving and traffic violation
byline: Legal action has been taken against nearly 9,000 drivers, including 251 for driving under the influence of liquor, for traffic violations and reckless driving within a 24-hour period that ended yesterday, police said.

title: Govt. has not yet decided when to assign official vehicles to MPs
byline: The government is yet to assign vehicles to the MPs of the new Parliament though it has taken a policy decision to do so.

title: Bird flu kills 20 big cats at US animal sanctuary
byline: Twenty big cats - including a Bengal tiger and four cougars - have died of bird flu over the past several weeks at an animal sanctuary in the state of Washington.

title: Definite salary increase for government employees by next year: Deputy Minister
byline: There will be a definite salary increase for government sector employees, including teachers, by next year, Deputy Minister of Economic Development Anil Jayantha Fernando said.

title: Excise proposes settlement of 50% defaulted tax to restore production licence of W. M. Mendis and Co.
byline: Making a fresh approach towards the stagnating tax issue of staggering Rs.5.8 billion defaulted by the local liquor giant W. M. Mendis and Co. Ltd. the newly appointed Excise Chief has proposed a way-out to settle 50% of the arrears to reactivate its suspended production licence, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Sharp increase in financial frauds during festive season: SLCERT
byline: An organized group is once again deceiving the public on a large scale, as evidenced by a sharp increase in financial fraud complaints during the Christmas and New Year season, Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Readiness Team (SLCERT) Chief Information Security Engineer Nirosh Ananda said.

title: SLPP decides on legal action over reducing MR’s security
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna had decided to go to court over reducing the strength of security provided to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: 18-hour water cut in Western Province starting tomorrow
byline: There will be an 18-hour water cut tomorrow (26) in several areas of the Western Province due to urgent repairs on the main transmission line, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board announced.

title: NMRA, SPC, SPMC, MSD must take responsibility of continuous supply of quality medicines: Minister
byline: Stressing the need to resolve issues in the supply of medicines soon, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said the National Medicine Regulatory Authority (NMRA), State Pharmaceuticals Corporation (SPC), State Pharmaceuticals Manufacturing Corporation (SPMC) and Medical Supplies Division (MSD) must take the responsibility of providing quality medicines to the people continuously.

title: STF to be deployed to control power cable thefts during night
byline: The Police Special Task Force (STF) will be deployed to contain theft of power cables laid to supply electricity to the Katunayake-Colombo expressway, according to a statement from the Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Ministry.

title: Revenue officer among two arrested for seeking chicken kilo as bribe
byline: Two persons including an acting revenue officer of the Weweldeniya Sub Office attached to the Mirigama Pradeshiya Sabha were arrested by the Bribery Commission for accepting one kilo of chicken worth Rs. 1,170 as a bribe.

title: ‘Cardinal’ only used to polish the floor: ’Pastor’ Jerome
byline: ’Pastor’ Jerome Fernando recently shared a nostalgic Facebook post recalling the role of the ’Cardinal’ brand in his childhood Christmas traditions.

title: Azerbaijan Airlines plane crashes over Kazakhstan
byline: A passenger plane carrying dozens has crashed near the Kazakhstani city of Aktau on Wednesday, the Kazakh Transport Ministry said.

title: SLTB launches special bus services for Christmas travel
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has initiated special and additional bus services to cater to commuters travelling during the Christmas festive season, SLTB Supervisory Officer Indika Chandimal said.

title: 385 prison inmates released under special State pardon
byline: The Department of Prisons announced today that a total of 385 prison inmates were released under a special State pardon in view of Christmas, Prison Commissioner (Media Spokesman) Gamini D. Dissanayake said.

title: ICC announce Champions Trophy 2025 fixtures
byline: India will face Pakistan in Dubai on 23 February as the International Cricket Council released the Champions Trophy fixtures on Tuesday.

title: 62 suspended CEB employees reinstated
byline: A total of 62 employees who were suspended for protesting against the privatisation of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) have been reinstated.
